result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Juan Carlos Marquez was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicles T&R in defendants name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant himself.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Absolute sobriety.   DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: with huber for work, treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system; to begin immediately.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 11:20am
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Dan Cveykus; Interpreter Darius Torres sworn and interprets for defendant.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State moves for court to receive 2nd Amended Complaint - COURT receives and accordingly THIS CASE BECOMES 15CF1214

Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  

State moves to:
Ct. 2 (PAC 4th)>>DISMISS
Ct. 3 (OAR)>>D&RI
Ct. 4 (Misd BJ)>>D&RI
COURT grants above.

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (OWI 4th)>> GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 3 years Probation.
CONDITIONS: $3000 inclusive of all financial obligations; DNA sample; 6 months MCJ w/huber for work/treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system (credit to be determined by stipulation to be filed by counsel), to begin immediately; 3 year DL Rev to begin today w/credit; AODA; Absolute sobriety;  Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant him/herself, both for a period of 3 years; IID to be installed within 2 weeks; $50 IID surcharge to be paid; Half-Priced IID ordered as defendant qualifies; Defendant must be in full compliance with IID order and DL rev order as conditions of probation.

Adj: 11:51am
12/23/15 Plea Hearing - No mail receptacle, unable to forward

State appears by ADA S.Brubacher.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Dan Cveykus.  Interpreter Teresa Berger sworn and interprets for defendant

Parties have agreement to 15CM861 only>>

15CM861 - Ct. 2 (PAC 2nd)>>DISMISS
15CM861 - Ct. 3 (OAR)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
15CM861 - Ct. 1 (OWI 2nd)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: $1379 inclusive plus AODA fee payment; 5 days MCJ w/huber for work/treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, to begin immediately; 12 month DL Rev w/credit; DNA sample and surcharge;  Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant him/herself, both for a period of 12 months; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid; AODA (deemed completed).

15CM1376>>State moves to AMEND Counts 1 and 2 to reflect 3rd offenses (OWI 3rd and PAC 3rd respectively) - COURT grants.
Atty Cveykus enters pleas of NOT GUILTY in all counts.
Bond continues in that case.
Parties to set plea hearing for a date after the defendant has plea in Taylor County case.

Original bond returned from jail.  Place a detainer with Taylor County; released back to Taylor on 9/11/15
